transcript:
what stoicism is is not being affected
by things that affect you it's kind of
weird things still affect you but you
don't let the things that affect you
control your life it's not that you're
numb there's a principle in Buddhism
called the two arrows and this principle
is that anytime life shoots an arrow at
us and we get hit by an arrow that hurts
and then what we do is shoot a second
Arrow at ourselves for being hit by the
first one stoicism is preventing that
second Arrow it's not that things don't
hurt Marcus Aurelius felt a full range
of emotions he was just tranquil in the
face of those emotions so Tranquility is
not about being numb it's about staying
grounded when there are emotions in
front of you and feeling those things
honestly kind of to the fullest and when
you feel them to the fullest they lose
their power over you
